fields.description:
Hi,

I currently use Bitbucket to track the number of downloads of our software by uploading versions to the "Downloads" section.  It would be great if Bitbucket would track the number of downloads for each tag in the "Tags" tab; that way I could just post the link to the appropriate tag and not need to re-upload a file for each version.

Thanks,\\
Paul
fields.summary: Track downloads for tags (BB-6896)

fields.description: In areas where users wish to highlight code, Bitbucket should support the additional options available in pygments for that specific lexer. For example, PHP has the 'startinline' option which some users may wish to utilize.
fields.summary: Accept pygments options in highlighting (BB-6775)

fields.description: Currently, a user needs to be the reporter or have write access to the repository for an issue tracker to edit an issue once it has been created. To remove an attachment, the user needs to be a repository administrator. This needs to be made more consistent.
fields.summary: Make issue editing and deleting attachment have the same permissions (BB-6774)

fields.description: It would be nice to have an option to wrap text when looking at side-by-side diffs if you have particularly long lines. Not a major issue - just a suggestion!
fields.summary: text wrapping on side-by-side diff (BB-6798)

fields.description: When filtering the list of commits by user (with user('xxx') in the search box), the "Next" button no longer moves to the next page (the first page is reloaded instead).
fields.summary: Filtered commit list does not move to next page (BB-6803)

fields.description:
I'm trying to pull some changesets from a coworker's repo. Apparently bitbucket is confused and thinks I'm trying to write to that repo:

{code}
$ hg pull -r a234e43 ssh://hg@bitbucket.org/d_guillaume/surycat-guillaume
remote: conq: the account owner 'd_guillaume' has exceeded their user limit - write access is disabled to the repository 'surycat-guillaume'.
abandon : no suitable response from remote hg !
{code}

This is a pretty big annoyance for our workflow.
fields.summary: Can't pull from read-only private repo (BB-6796)

fields.description:
Please refer also to Orchard item: 402815\\
PS: have no idea to whom to send this ..\\
when using a brand new Orchard 1.6 (downloaded from WebMatrix); implementing (only) the 'FeaturedItemSlider 2.0' from the Gallery and defining\\
one group with 3 items I observe:

* ONLY one (1) slider cycle!
* clicking the appropriate page again(which contains the widget)  - starts with first Item and cycles again to the second - and stops cycling!

PS: same behavior when using the virgin Orchard.Source!\\
in Script documents I see: jquery-1.8.2.js and jquery.cycle.all.js

? could it be that there is another '...cycle.js' active ? how would I find it?

ATTENTION ATTENTION\\
As absurd as it might sound: ALL under Orchard 1.6 I made using 'Windows 8 pro'!\\
Therefore, I went back to a Orchard site which I created under 1.5.1 in W7 ult, AND in there, I have a running\\
FeaterdItemSlider.\\
Now, when defining in this 1.5.1 site (now using W8) a new FeaterGroup and its items the cycling stops still after one (1) cycle!\\
However, the original, old, Slider still works fine.\\
PS: unfortunately I do not have a W7 anymore to test!

what am I possibly missing  .. ?\\
thanks for your time and advise\\
ed
fields.summary: FeturedItemSlider 2.0 cycles ONLY once (Orchard 1.6)

Bitbucket Team,

ERROR:\\

please resolve my issue as soon as possible.

Regards\\
Harikrishna.T

I am trying to change a project's logo (or project image, don't know the proper term) and it seems to fail. After clicking the link, the selected image will not be uploaded and the project's configuration will not be updated. I have attached a fragment of a screenshot for you to see what happens after selecting the image in the browser.

I have tried using Google Chrome, Mozilla Firefox and Opera desktop, and the same behavior is observed in all three.
fields.summary: Can't change a project's logo

fields.description:
I use BitBucket for most of my coding projects but I would love to use it for my Android programming as well.  I look at the Language dropdown when creating a repository and sadly, Android is not there.

Can you add "Android" to the "Language" drop down for repositories please?

I would really like to use BitBucket to source control my projects.
fields.summary: Adding language option for Android development

fields.description:
Hi,

So I've created a new team with an email address wich goes to a trusted mailing list - which I now realise I can't confirm from when asked as my email address is personal. Is there a get around for this?
fields.summary: Team Email Address

fields.description:
Hi,\\
I'm trying to create a new repository but the request is still pending.

If you try to open this URL https://bitbucket.org/intentfactory/core-platform-promo-system you can see this message "Please wait a moment while we create your repository."

I attach the screen shot
fields.summary: Repository creation still pending

fields.description: Issue tracker: Probably already been mentioned but it would be useful if instead of filtering by "open" OR "my issues" you could perform both, returning only outstanding issues which apply to you.
fields.summary: Display only MY OPEN issues

fields.description:
When attempting to open a file from the view file button in the commit screen - i get a 404 screen\\
the file is a UTF-16 file - and as such is regarded by git as a binary file - my guess is that is part of the problem
fields.summary: View File button send to a 404 page

fields.description:
I'm using milestones in my project.

My team and I would like to see the outstanding issues grouped by milestone.

Clicking on the milestone column header sorts, and effectively groups them.

But, the milestones are shown by order created.  This makes it impossible to 'insert' or re-order milestones.

If the milestones were sorted alphabetically it would be possible to lead the milestone name with a version number, date, or counter - to provide a customisable way of sorting them.
fields.summary: Order milestones alphabetically, not by order created

fields.description:
As project lead I'm able to configure BitBucket to receive notifications on new issues.

But, it now seems I'm repeatedly missing questions posed by developers in the comments that respond to the issues.

I believe that BitBucket should send notifications for issue comments as well as issues - certainly to the issue originator and assignee.
fields.summary: Notifications for issue comments

fields.description:
Hello,

If possible, we'd like to see an option where the issue tracker could be limited to users with bitbucket accounts.

Thanks,\\
Ben
fields.summary: Issue Access Option: Restrict Issues to Registered Users

fields.description:
I would like to have the ability from the wiki to embed a file (not link) into the contents of a wiki page. I am writing a tutorial where I have examples in a bitbucket repository and I would like the wiki to point to the most current tip of the examples. However, the linking back and forth makes this cumbersome. Being able to embed the file (with similar syntax to the link) would be a great feature.\\
Thanks
fields.summary: Ability to embed (not link) a file in a wiki page (BB-7694)

fields.description:
See https://bitbucket.org/zc/botokeyring

The README.rst is a symbolic link to src/zc/botokeyring/README.rst.

git handles this just fine. :)

It would be great if bitbucket did too and showed the rendered contents as the project overview.

(The README.rst is testable documentation.  It's most convenient if it's in the source directory, both for running tests and so it's included in binary Python distributions.)
fields.summary: Handle symbolic link to READMEs (BB-6765)

fields.description:
In the issue-tracker, when opening a mile-stone, it would be nice to have a progress-bar, showing how close to completion that milestone is.

Every issue assigned to a milestone is a "point" on the progress-bar, giving it it's total length (so 10 issues for a milestone would be a progress-bar length of 10) and every issue that is marked as "solved" is a point for the progress.

*Example* (12 issues, 4 solved):

bq. |####--------|
fields.summary: Add a progress-bar to milestone pages
Trim username field on login page (BB-6763)

fields.description:
I have put my project\\
git pull git@bitbucket.org:arkebi/aatma.git

then I am getting this error\\
ssh: bitbucket.org:no address associated with name\\
fatal:The remote end hung up unexpectedly

Can u help me in this case\\
address is correct\\
I have used that dozens of times\\
I just changed from windows 7 to windows 8 and finding this error
fields.summary: Git pull says no address associated with name

fields.description:
Using topic branches and doing pull requests creates considerable clutter.  Well documented here:

http://blog.bitbucket.org/2012/05/14/accept-pull-requests-and-auto-close-branches/

That article says that the solution is "auto close branch", but that only works when you're all working off the same repository.  Otherwise auto-close doesn't seem to be available.

I can't work around this by having everyone in the same repository because there are no branch level permissions.  See this bug report, where the "wontfix" rationale is that you can just use forks:

https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issue/4404/read-only-master-branch-everything-has-to

Fixing either issue would solve the problem as far as I'm concerned.  Allow auto-close everywhere, or give us branch level permissions.
fields.summary: Branch permissions (BB-6761)

fields.description:
Hi - I'm curious if you'd be interested in adding a code type of "epub" for repositories.  It's very similar to html/css, but is a particular file structure where a bunch of html, css, and xml files are zipped up into a package.  I'm a small publisher (bitingduckpress.com) and we're finding that version control for epubs during book development and editing is tricky.

I'm mostly on the technical side of things, and am trying to move the word-side of things to using git.  We're just starting to do git version control using html/css (what all the epubs start out as) but it would be a nice feature to be able to stick an epub in a repo and track changes to the individual files.  It's probably not a big market for you right now, but it's got the potential for growth, as epub workflow and version control is pretty primitive right now.  A lot of people use Adobe Indesign, which is actually _much_ harder than working in a text editor and gives worse results (worse looking epubs with basic features missing).  We typically are working on 5-10 titles at a time, with 3-4 people passing around edits.  It's the kind of thing that I'd eventually put together for myself, but have my hands full with the rest of building/maintaining the web store and running the business. It's probably mostly a change to your source browser, so I'm flagging it there.

Thanks for at least reading this, and for offering a nice online service.

chris lindensmith
fields.summary: epub repositories?

fields.description: Trying to reset my bitbucket password and the generated link goes to a 404 page.

fields.description: As the title says. The Pull Requests from deleted repos should at least load and inform you what happened.

fields.description:
Hi,

This summer I worked with Bitbucket for my previous employer. Your services are so great that I suggested to implement it for my current (new) employer.

The situation is that I migrated all the repos (about 180) from an old SVN-server to Bitbucket. Since I'm no longer employed by them, I got revoked from their group, thus no longer having access to their repositories.

The problem, now, is that I am still following all the repositories that I created, but I can't see a way to unfollow them, because of the revoked access...

If you need more information, feel free to send me a message.

Cheers,\\
Angelo
fields.summary: Revoked from group = still following their projects?

fields.description:
I may have done something silly with git. I removed files from the repository, erasing their history, with such command: git filter-branch --tree-filter 'rm file' HEAD. Then, after committing, when pushing the results, there was conflicts because it says that i haven't got the newest state of my branch. So, without knowing what to do (i'm very new to git), i forced the push. And everything went fine after.

But when i was on the web page of my repository, i clicked on the last commit, to see what it contains. After some time, a page written "500, Something went wrong" appeared. When i clicked on a other commit, it displays the correct results.

So i think that what i've done, with my forced push, is not handled by the web user interface, and leads every time to an error.
fields.summary: seeing a commit in which they are deleted history after a forced push leads to a web user interface error

fields.description: When I create an issue tracker component that is causing an error the message show is wrong. Instead of an information I get "[object Object]".
fields.summary: Wrong error message on adding new issue tracker component

fields.description:
embedded markdown renderer ignore *™* entity and instead of displaying small TM it displays ™\\
http://www.showdown.im/ site displays it correctly.
fields.summary: markdown render does not display ™ (BB-6795)

fields.description:
Scenario:

* User A has an existing repo R in their personal account and creates a team account
* User A adds User B to the Developers group for the team, with read/write perms
* User A transfers repo R from personal account to team account

Bug:

* User B has no access to repo R, cannot even see it listed under team's repos

Solution:

* User A goes to team groups page
* User A sets Developers group's permissions to "no access"
* User A sets Developers group's permissions back to read/write
fields.summary: Team members' repository access rights not applied to transferred repositories

fields.description:
Git is down - any attempt to connect gets "Disconnected: No supported authentication methods available (server sent: publickey)"

Tried both pull and push, server hangs up.
fields.summary: Git is down

fields.description:

You can contact support or create a public issue if the problem persists.

This might be useful in debugging the problem:

03317ab9c436451b81672198fa4320db$0be1a9decf4bedcd4648210d54de5a89

You can also visit our status page.

{code}

fields.description:
Hi support,

i'm one of the administrators of two paying accounts of the Company "hybris": user "hybris" and user "hybrismanagedservices".

Recently i wanted to get rid of a large binary in the repo and so i deleted "hybris/puppet-zookeeper" in order to recreate it again. AFAIK i've done recreation in the past sucessfully. But this time i couldn't recreate it. So i created one in my own space and tried to tranfer it but this didn't help either.

I attached a screenshot which might provide some more context.

Can you help here?

I appologize for the priority but this is at least critical for us. The repository is highly used in "hybris/puppet-modules" and "hybris/devop-vagrants" as submodules and fiddling around with nested submodules on mercurial is expecially no fun, if repos get deleted and recreated (but it's better than cloning large binaries for the next years ;-) )

thanks

Kim Neunert
fields.summary: Recreation of repositories not possible

fields.description:
in the source browser (ie bitbucket.org), currently it appears you can only view the commit history for a repository for a single branch.  it would be helpful to view the commit history for each branch in a repository, similar to github.

i apologize if this is a duplicate, i could not find it in the search.

meanwhile, thanks for the great product.
fields.summary: view commit log per branch (BB-6708)
500 error

fields.description:
Team/account name in list forces long repo names to be truncated. This becomes an issue with projects that have similar client and project prefixes before the specific project name (like our team does):

* teamName / ClientName.ProjectType.SpecificProjectNameA
* teamName / ClientName.ProjectType.SpecificProjectNameB
* teamName / ClientName.ProjectType.SpecificProjectNameC

Suggestions:

* smaller font size for list
* separation of team/account name (aka meta) and repo name over two lines
* user option to display team/account name (maybe it's only relevant in some lists?)
fields.summary: Long repo names are truncated (BB-6726)

fields.description:
Can't view all repositories on it's own page, clear and navigable, related to my account.

This page would essentially be the Repositories Panel placed in the left hand column of page so that it is more digestible.
fields.summary: Would like to see a more full listing of all repositories (BB-6728)

fields.description:
I think is the same problem reported here: [https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issue/4626]

My scenario and the test:\\
I'm following 10 projects from a Team user. 9 of them have the same token id.

I commit on one of them. All projects changed theirs token ids.

So it's impossible to follow these projects using an external feed reader.

Te one i committed to:\\
https://bitbucket.org/nexusdinet/dmtf/rss?token=a6c701921b593d65ad3f7ce01ca7f907\\
After commit:\\
https://bitbucket.org/nexusdinet/dmtf/rss?token=3ef3d7beec538169a86114fa0fe1c67c

The other 8 projects, before (2 examples):\\
https://bitbucket.org/nexusdinet/cayennezkwebapp/rss?token=a6c701921b593d65ad3f7ce01ca7f907\\
https://bitbucket.org/nexusdinet/nexussiee/rss?token=a6c701921b593d65ad3f7ce01ca7f907

After the commit:\\
https://bitbucket.org/nexusdinet/cayennezkwebapp/rss?token=df152e365b5341559fa8994eaa097851\\
https://bitbucket.org/nexusdinet/nexussiee/rss?token=df152e365b5341559fa8994eaa097851

Opps! NO!!!, i refresh again the page an now the valid token is id for all projects:\\
3ef3d7beec538169a86114fa0fe1c67c

I don't know what's going on here! Hope you can track this token id!

I like this feature because allow us to follow what we change easyly. Please, take a look at this and fix it.

Thank you
fields.summary: RSS link get obsolete for private projects

fields.description:
Dear Bitbucket team,

Feature / Enhancement request:\\
Please add a step to verify identity before automatically associating the last/currently logged in user with an invitation for a new team or a new repository.

Motiviation:\\
Many users accept invitations received by email without noticing that they are already logged into bitbucket with a different username. Typically, they have an active login in some other tab in their browser. This is a very easy to make mistake, and the consequence is that the associations become incorret.

When used for private/confidential information, the current behavior is more or less a show stopper.

Best regards\\
Viktor
fields.summary: Verify identity before automatically associating the last/currently logged in user with an invitation (BB-7733)

fields.description:
I am trying to perform a strip (for rev 8bae053) on a repository [1]. When I confirm I get "Strip complete". However, when I come back on the commits page I get the following message: "There was an error while executing the strip task."

How can I complete the strip operation? what is wrong?

[1] https://bitbucket.org/eventcloud/eventcloud
fields.summary: Repository Strip
git submodule update --init says Permission denied (publickey).

fields.description:
Gives an error "Wiki macro error: expected string or buffer" when used to show local page contents.  For example, this page was posted in the "how to use the toc macro" comments long ago but now the example for local page contents is broken:

https://bitbucket.org/marijnvanderzee/build-wiki/wiki/TocTests

I use <<toc 2>> on my pages, none of the pages changed but recently they all start with that error instead of showing the toc.
fields.summary: Wiki toc macro now broken on pages it used to work on that have not changed

fields.description:
The wiki editor is not using fixed-width font. However this "Create issue" editor is using one.

I suspect it would be better if the wiki editor uses a fixed-width font, so we can put in pre-formatted blocks (e.g. source code) more easily.

Or perhaps it's a bug. I'm using Mac OS X 10.7.5 with Google Chrome 23.0.1271.91
fields.summary: Use a fixed-width font for the wiki text editor (BB-6721)

fields.description:
I'm new in using git so do not know if is a bug or an "errata usage".

In web interface I create a repository

I configured sourceTree and it seems to work fine. Have done done an add of a project and a couple of commit.

The trouble is that I cannot see anything in the web interface, it still remain in "The source directory is empty".

I configured an unique user so I think it is not a visibility trouble.

Thanks
fields.summary: commit OK in sourceTree does not display in web interface

fields.description: I've set up a POST service hook for my project (cblock/projektmanager) but the url is never invoked from bitbucket. Calling the url from other servers works though without any problem and these other GET and POST requests are also properly logged into the server's nginx log files.
fields.summary: POST service hook not executed

fields.description:
I performed a commit to my (private) repo. When I look on bitbucket, I see my commit, but the my name does not resolve to my profile (although of course I authenticated myself)

How can I ensure that this commit is linked my profile, isn't this something Bitbucket should recognize itself?
fields.summary: Comitter not recognized?

fields.description:
It would be great if I could anonymously (that is without having my public key on current machine) pull public repositories via SSH.

Problem is as follows:

# I have a private repo that uses git submodules to pull bunch of my repositories (that are mostly public).
# Since I use git submodules I need to have the same ssh urls both on my developement machine and my deployment machnie. Example of such url is: git@bitbucket.org:jbzdak/django-mailhide.git
# For my non-public repositories I use deployment keys and everything works OK.
# But since I have a lot of sub repositories it would be nice if my public repositores would work without the need uploading deployment keys to them.
# Since my repository paths are fixed I can't switch to HTTPS, it would really be nice if cloning remote repostiories via ssh would work.
fields.summary: Would like to clone over SSH anonymously for public repos (BB-6718)

fields.description:
martinoflynn / Absorbine Web Crawler\\
martinoflynn / AppUpdate Example iOS\\
martinoflynn / Buffalo Bills 2011\\
martinoflynn / DropboxExample\\
martinoflynn / Hada Labo USA\\
martinoflynn / Harris Presentation Concept\\
martinoflynn / Martino Flynn Intranet\\
martinoflynn / Martino Flynn Video Room\\
martinoflynn / Timesheetr\\
martinoflynn / TumbleAdventure

I need these ones removed from my following list.  Not sure how because they are all private and I do not have access.  New job now.
fields.summary: Following Repos But No Longer part of team
Bug in duplicated Account

fields.description:
This doesn't change when a colleague adds a comment e.g. "Done".

I think this is a bug. If you disagree, then please add this as a feature request!

Will
fields.summary: Issues last updated column does not update (BB-6729)

fields.description:
When performing review of a pull request we are often using commenting feature.\\
The problem is that line comments getting slower and slower the bigger PR gets.

It ends up with us typing a few comments and then waiting for the text to slowly show up.. This has never been an issue in i.e GitHub that has similar feature. Is the comment section trying to perform something smart during the typing?
fields.summary: Commenting on large Pull Request is very slow

fields.description:
Hello,

This morning I tried to delete and recreate a repository named ELA - Sitecore Website with PixelMEDIA as the owner. I successfully deleted the old repo but when I tried to recreate it I got a 500 error. So I tried creating a test repo with a different one named asdsadasdasd. It didn't throw a 500 error but it appears to be hung. When I try to access the repo, it just shows a screen saying it's creating it.

So I have two issues:\\
First, why does the creation fail for the repo named ELA - Sitecore Website?\\
Second, can you get rid of the asdsadasdasd repo?
fields.summary: Repo Creation is hung

fields.description:
I have created a new repository but the creation process hangs.\\
No delete possible.

Repository URL https://bitbucket.org/LifestreamCreations/pdfkitten
fields.summary: Creation of repository hangs

fields.description:
I've had trouble cloning and downloading a repository lately. When trying to clone the project I get this error:

abort: [Errno 1] _ssl.c:1359: error:1408F119:SSL routines:SSL3_GET_RECORD:decryption failed or bad record mac!

(Which by the way is exactly the same error I experienced on CodeBaseHQ, they solved by changing a file-system mount according to their support)

Also when I try to download the repo as a zip-file the download dies on before finishing every time i try.
fields.summary: Not able to clone repository anymore

fields.description:
The repository list shown on profile pages is just a list of linked names, with no information about the repository.

It would be a lot more useful if the description was shown underneath each repository.
fields.summary: Show description in the profile repository list

fields.description: Watching an issues should be an ajax operation (like it was before the new design), not a full page refresh.
fields.summary: Watching an issues should not refresh the page

fields.description:
the link for the html doc seems to be broken\\
http://tortoisehg.bitbucket.org/manual/2.6/
fields.summary: dead link - Docs

fields.description:
I think it would be nice to be able to link people to the Tags section of the Downloads page for a repository. Currently I can only link to the Downloads page and it always starts with the custom downloads I've added, but there are situations where I would want to link right to the tag downloads.

So, something like https://bitbucket.org/username/repo-name/downloads/tags or https://bitbucket.org/username/repo-name/downloads#tags
fields.summary: Feature request: Link to Tags Download page (BB-5185)

fields.description:
Just had a really frustrating experience, so thought I'd pass along some thoughts on the subject in case they're useful to you.

So, a user messaged me directly with a question. I received a notification as an email. The only link in the email was listed as having a purpose of disabling notifications, so I didn't want to click it. I started a reply-to, but the email was of the "no-reply" variety, so figured that was the wrong way to go.

I browsed to the relevant bitbucket repos, but the activity didn't list anything like the notification i had received. I clicked on the dropdown in the upper right corner, nothing about notifications. Click my profile, nothing involving notifications.

I finally gave up trying to reply to the notification and looked up the user directly and saw a send message button. So, I message him. As soon as I messaged them I'm redirected to the "Messages" area which lists his original message that I received a notification about. I look at the URL and realize it matches the "disabling" link from the email. sigh. So, then I'm like there must be some way to get to this Messages area directly. I poke around. And eventually after scanning for it half a dozen times I realize it's supposed to be the same as Inbox.

So, the email notification says nothing about Inbox or Messages. The Messages screen says nothing about Inbox, and none of the links in Bitbucket seem to point to Notifications or Messages.

Now that I know these are the same things I'll be ok, but would have been great if they used the same word.

Cheers,\\
Laura
fields.summary: Might want to unify the messaging/notifications system terminology

fields.description:
The h3's (and below) on my overview readme are too high and don't look right.  The reason being that they have a bottom margin of 5px and no top margin.  This makes them appear to belong to the preceding paragraph instead of the one underneath.  e.g.:

{code}
Blah blah blah.
.
HEADER3_TEXT
.
.
Blah blah blah.
{code}

Please remove the margin or add a larger one to the top of the h3.
fields.summary: h3 are misaligned vertically on readme css (BB-6724)

fields.description:
To Repeat:\\
Choose Fork for an existing repo owned by Team\\
Choose Create a Patch Queue near top right\\
Fill in form, choosing the Team as the owner and using mercurial (I omitted series, but I doubt that is relevant)\\
Submit form

Expected behaviour:\\
New repo created, as patch queue of existing repo, with team as owner

Behaviour observed:\\
New repo created, as patch queue of existing repo, but with me as owner

Work-around:\\
Create patch queue repo as above, with wrong owner\\
In the settings for the new patch queue repo, choose to transfer ownership to the desired Team
fields.summary: Team as initial Patch Queue owner broken (BB-6723)

fields.description:
Hi, thanks for Bitbucket!

I'm signing up a lot of people who are new to issue tracking, wikis etc - and they are complaining about being spammed all the time with email notifications.

Any of the following features would help:

-Ability for project administrators to set whether new users default to receiving notifications

-Add select box for email notifications in user access management, so that I can deselect it upon adding a user if I wish

-User opts in for email notifications upon signup

Thanks!
fields.summary: Optional email notifications on signup

fields.description:
Hi,\\
I installed the DRC Simulator following Pre-compiled binaries instructions (http://gazebosim.org/wiki/InstallDRC) using ubuntu 12.04 LTS and i didnt get any error messages. When i try to run the simulator with :

fields.description:
Provide feature to create sub-items/sub-issues.

Similar to the feature in Jira.

Enables better planning and tracking.
fields.summary: Feature request: Create sub-items

fields.description:
After removing the account, I can not register. When you attempt to register messages are displayed:

A user with that username already exists.\\
This email address is already in use. Please supply a different email address.

But when you try to log on to your account getting information: Invalid username / email or password
fields.summary: After removing the account, I can not register.

fields.description:
Po usunięciu konta nie mogę się zarejestrować. Podczas próby rejestracji, pojawią się komunikaty:

A user with that username already exists.\\
This email address is already in use. Please supply a different email address.

Ale przy próbie logowania na to konto dostaję informację: Invalid username/email or password
fields.summary: Po usunięciu konta nie mogę się zarejestrować.

fields.description:
When viewing a GPG-signed git commit, the GPG signature is visible as plain text.

It also appears before the commit message, causing some problems when looking through history.

One example: https://bitbucket.org/CruzBishop/7-dream/changeset/a1c4f859992b09f54ac8efb58f161b45

Another example (shortlog): https://bitbucket.org/CruzBishop/7-dream/changesets

I don't mean to advertise my own repository, it is simply the first case I have seen :)
fields.summary: Unappealing output when parsing the message of a GPG-signed git commit (BB-6683)

fields.description:
Hi,

I've got a TFS repo that I'm keeping synchronised with bitbucket for a few weeks as we are transitioning from TFS to bitbucket.

The problem is that with TFS we were using Windows authentication and so all our commits (incluing for our history) are comming in the format DOMAIN\username. This is fine and I was planning to just add aliases in bitbucket to bridge the gap. However, when setting up and alias in bitbucket the backslashes get converted to forward slashes when saving, so the new aliases don't end up matching anything.

This is a minor bug but still annoying, especially when those usernames then get propagated to Bamboo.

Thanks
fields.summary: Username aliases don't support backslashes (BB-6685)

fields.description:
Is it possible to create custom domain for static website on Bitbucket?\\
The case is:\\
I have myname account on Bitbucket, and mydomain.org domain. I would like to point blog.mydomain.org to static website, which is at myname.bitbucket.org.

The page [Publishing a Website on Bitbucket|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/Publishing%2Ba%2BWebsite%2Bon%2BBitbucket]  says that it is somehow possible. But the only think I can do (using [Associate an Existing Domain with Your Account|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/Associate%2Ban%2BExisting%2BDomain%2Bwith%2BYour%2BAccount]) is to point _blog.mydomain.org_ to _bitbucket.org/myname_  so I suppos it is not possible.

Can you calarify it in the documentation (Publishing a Website on Bitbucket)?
fields.summary: Using custom domain for static pages.

fields.description:
The ability to add custom fields (and filter on them) would be very useful.

For example we currently need field to record what project stage/sprint the ticket will be addressed in.
fields.summary: Custom fields for issues (BB-6719)

fields.description: Currently there is no way set up filtering to get lists of tickets defined by custom filters. For example "all open tickets for user x for component y".
fields.summary: Need some user definable filtering for tickets

fields.description:
No error messages and nothing suspicious in the browser error logs. Press the button "create" get the "wheel" for a second and then nothing happens. Fortunately, I was able to create the pull request in another browser.

I have successfully created pull requests using Opera in the past but this is the first time since the new skin so it may be related to that. I haven't noticed any other problems.
fields.summary: Can't create a pull request in Opera

fields.description:
On the pages where there is a "Recent Activity" list, the text says:

John Doe committed to jd/foo\\
2 minutes ago

That is not correct, because the commit has been done 3 days ago, either the minutes should actually say 3 days ago, OR the text should be

John Doe pushed to jd/foo\\
2 minutes ago
fields.summary: Terminology
